reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend and had a wonderful two days. The room was fantastic - great views to the river, well furnished and great colour scheme. But what really made the weekend was the fantastic attitude of the staff from the manager to the cleaner of the room. All were extremely helpful and cheerful. We had a slight problem with the door - it was fixed straight away - we asked for lots of decaf and milk and when we returned, there it was. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: A great hotel

likes.disliked: — lack of lift to second floor

reviews.text: We stayed in a family room no.31. Up 4 flights of stairs with no lift! It was disgusting. The bed was ancient and filthy. The base had stains all down it and the sheets did not cover it so we had to sleep on top under our own blankets. No bedspread either for the double so we had to look at the filth all day. The TV had been bashed in on the corner and the bathroom was 1970's decor & fittings with tiles fallen off revealing 1960's wallpaper underneath. The 1970's shower dribbled & it was impossible to wash properly. The room was gloomy due to inadequate lighting and I had to prop the mirror on magazines to be able to see in it. The childrens' room had a TV (indoor aerial so unwatchable) & the power lead was through a DIY extension reel into our room!
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was a disaster. The organisation was non-existent and not only was the food awful but actually inedible. We have never tasted sausages or bacon like it. We were given half a piece of toast each and the jams were the cheapest available. We left it and left the hotel!
reviews.title: loved it..fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: The dining room at dinner was unbearably noisy as a large office group of about 26 dominated half of the room and the noise drowned out the background music and we couldn't hear each other talk. Shame because the food at dinner (which we paid for separately and was £90 for 4 incl. wine) was actually very nice.
reviews.title: let down at the last hurdle
Don't let the 'old reviews' put you off!
reviews.text: we booked a feature room on a very good deal through old engliush inns. When we were shown to room 15 it took my breath away. beautifully decorated, fantastic views. hugh bed and a massive flat screen tv. The whole hotel was very clean and tidy and the staff were fantastic and really looked after us. Breakfast we good and the dinner on the terrace well worth it . All in all a perfect weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed a few times now at The Royal either in a standard double room or a room with a river view. The location is excellent and the hotel is very well maintained. Each time the bedroom has been spacious, well furnished and clean. The food is excellent both on a night and at breakfast, good choice, fresh and served piping hot. Very nice restaurant and bar area to choose from as well as a lovely small sitting room to relax in. Staff are friendly and efficient. Definitely coming back in the future.
reviews.title: Love The Royal

reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal for a wedding, and took our one year old baby with us. We were a bit apprehensive about having him in a hotel for the first time, but we needn't have worried.
reviews.title: Great value, a pleasant stay

reviews.text: We were given a family room (30), and unlike the reviewer below who stayed in 31, it was very nice. The room was huge and spacious, with plenty of room for a double and a single bed, plus a large sofa and armchair. Although it wasn't particularly modern, it was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: A dump - keep away!

likes.liked: — Nothing really, the bar was nice.

reviews.text: We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and the public areas of the hotel were very pleasant, especially the recently refurbished bar, with a terrace overlooking the Wye valley. At £2.25 a pint for real ales, it was pretty good value too!
reviews.title: great twixmas break at the royal hotel
Great Stay
reviews.text: Overall, the Royal isn't hugely luxurious, and it isn't modern, but it is friendly, comfortable and good value. I'd certainly go back for a family trip, and wouldn't object if I got put in here for business.

We visited for 2 nights over the Easter weekend and did get a good deal at about 65 pounds B&B. We stayed in the stables wing which was fine, maybe more recently refurbished than the main building. The room was clean and very quiet, however the extractor fan in the bathroom (no window) did not work and one of the room lights also was not working. We ate in the bistro on Saturday night which was very gloomy with no music, little atmosphere and even fewer people unsurprisingly!
reviews.title: Can't agree with last!
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast however deserves a special mention. When my girlfriend requested bacon and tomato I think she expected more than one solitary rasher and half a tomato. I went for kippers to receive a solitary boiled in the bag kipper.

Having had breakfast and dinner at the hotel I find it VERY unlikely that 'The restaurant and bar were full all of the time with people coming from far and wide to eat'. Draw your own conclusions on that post.
reviews.title: Shabby

reviews.text: Oh - also requested morning papers that never showed up.
reviews.title: Dreadful hotel

reviews.text: We booked this hotel and then were very concerned after reading the reviews on here about the food. The hotel as people have said could do with a lick of paint but the food and the service was absolutely excellent and you could not have asked for anything better. We ate in the hotel all the time we stayed there. The restaurant and bar were full all of the time with people coming from far and wide to eat.
reviews.title: Not value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked room-only on a late availability deal. It was unbelievably cheap for the quality of the hotel. We got a fairly basic room, which was clean and comfortable, with a little wear in places on the carpet, but otherwise absolutely fine. A few complimentary snacks and all the facilities you'd expect. We had a view of the Wye and old town walls. There was a heated terrace near to the comfortable bar, which had views out to the river, but lower down the hill about 3 minutes' walk away was a pub with a brilliant riverside setting. Also the King's Head bar is very near and worth a visit. The town centre is also about 3 minutes' walk away from the Royal. Friendly reception staff. Would recommend - the works have definitely finished now.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: Just home from a christmas weekend .
reviews.title: under renovation but should be good when finished early 2007
